arm_group.description: All patients undergoing first or redo cardiac surgery with or without cardiopulmonary bypass necessitating general and/or local anesthesia. If they present any EEG abnormality intraoperatively an immediate cerebral CT scan will be performed and the necessary measures will be taken to reduce the neurologic damage.

brief_summary.textblock:
The underlying assumption of the project is that perioperative neuromonitoring and in
      particular electroencephalogram - based cerebral monitoring (EEG) can improve the short- and
      mid-term neurologic outcome of patients undergoing cardiac surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Cerebral Monitoring on Neurologic Outcome in Cardiac Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All adult patients undergoing first or redo cardiac surgery with or without
             cardiopulmonary bypass and with or without general anesthesia

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients sedated and/or intubated before the procedure

intervention.intervention_name: If any intraoperative EEG abnormality and/or asymmetry is detected a cerebral CT scan will be performed in the immediate postoperative period

other_outcome.measure: Any abnormalities detected by bilateral cerebral Oximetry and its agreement with the NeuroSENSE®  cerebral monitor

primary_outcome.measure: Any abnormalities or any asymmetry on bilateral raw frontal EEG analyzed by the NeuroSENSE®  cerebral monitor

reference.citation: Momeni M, Baele P, Jacquet LM, Peeters A, Noirhomme P, Rubay J, Docquier MA. Detection by NeuroSENSE(®) Cerebral Monitor of Two Major Neurologic Events During Cardiac Surgery. J Cardiothorac Vasc Anesth. 2013 Nov 27. pii: S1053-0770(13)00486-2. doi: 10.1053/j.jvca.2013.08.012. [Epub ahead of print]

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

secondary_outcome.measure: The presence and the duration of burst suppression detected by the NeuroSENSE®  cerebral monitor

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
